SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AlreadyStartedGameException
Exception thrown when attempting to start a game that has already been started.
App
The main class that serves as the entry point for the application.
Board
This class represents the game board of the game.
BoardNavigator
This class represents the navigator of the game board.
BoardTile
This class represents the single tile of the game board It has methods to check the single tile content and to change it
Bookshelf
This class represents the Bookshelf of the game, a 6x5 Matrix of Item elements.
BookshelfNavigator
The BookshelfNavigator class represents a navigator for a bookshelf.
Client
The Client interface represents a client in the game.
ClientMethodCallHandler
This class handles the method calls received from the client.
ClientRMI
Represents a client using the RMI protocol.
ClientSocket
The ClientSocket class represents a socket-based client for the game.
ColumnNotValidException
This exception is thrown when a column is not valid in a certain context.
CommonGoal
This abstract class represents all the Common Goals in the game and implements the Goal interface with the isAchieved() method to check whether the goal is achieved or not.
CommonGoal01
This class represents the CommonGoals number 0 and 1 CommonGoal description: numberOfGroups groups each containing at least dim tiles of the same type.
CommonGoal10
This class represents Common Goal number 10, which states that the goal is achieved when there are five tiles of the same color forming an X in the Bookshelf.
CommonGoal11
This class represents Common Goal 11.
CommonGoal2
This class represents the CommonGoal 2 This goal is achieved when there are 4 tiles of the same ElementType placed in the 4 corners of the player's Bookshelf
CommonGoal3
This class represents the CommonGoal 3 This goal is achieved if the board contains at least 2 of the following group of tiles.
CommonGoal4
This class represents Common Goal number 4, which states that a player must have three different columns of six consecutive tiles with no more than three different colors in each column.
CommonGoal5
This class represents Common Goal number 5, which is achieved when there are 8 elements of the same type in the whole Bookshelf.
CommonGoal6
This class represents Common Goal number 6, which is achieved when there are 5 diagonally placed tiles of the same ElementType in the Bookshelf.
CommonGoal7
This class represents Common Goal number 7, which states that a player must have four different rows of five consecutive tiles with no more than three different colors in each row.
CommonGoal8
This class represents Common Goal number 8, which states that the goal is achieved when there are two columns, each formed by 6 different types of tiles, in the Bookshelf.
CommonGoal9
This class represents Common Goal number 9, which states that the goal is achieved when there are two lines, each formed by 5 different types of tiles, in the Bookshelf.
CommonGoalDeck
This class represents the concrete CommonGoalDeck.
CommonGoalPointStack
This class represents the stack of points associated with a common goal.
Configuration
This class is used to load the configuration file.
ConnectionException
This exception is thrown when a connection error occurs.
Controller
The Controller class handles the game logic and communication between the server and clients.
ControllerRemoteInterface
The ControllerRemoteInterface interface represents the remote interface of the controller.
ControllerStatusToFile
This class represents the controller status to file, which contains information about the current game ID, already used player IDs, and a list of credentials.
Coordinates
This class represents the coordinates of a point on a grid.
CreateNewGameController
This class represents the controller for creating a new game.
CreateNewGameException
The CreateNewGameException class represents an exception that is thrown when there is an error creating a new game.
Deck<T>
This abstract class represents the abstract concept of a generic Deck made of Objects
DisconnectedPlayerException
Exception thrown when a player is disconnected from the game.
EndGameController
Controller class for the end game screen.
ExceptionEnum
This enumeration represents the different types of exceptions that can occur in the game.
FinishedGameException
This exception is thrown when attempting to perform an action on a finished game.
Game
This class represents the game instance of the MyShelfie board game.
GameAlreadyCreatedException
This exception is thrown when a game has already been created and another attempt to create a game is made.
GameNotStartedException
Exception thrown when attempting to perform an operation on a game that has not started yet.
GamePageController
Controller class for the game page view.
GameState
This interface represents the abstract concept of a generic GameState
GameStateFinished
Represents the state of the game when it has finished.
GameStateLastTurn
Represents the game state for the last turn of the game.
GameStateRunning
This class represents the state of the game when it is running
GameStateStarting
This class represents the state of the game when it has not started yet.
GameStatusToFile
This class represents the game status to be saved to a file.
GameStatusToSend
This class represents the status of the game to be sent to clients.
GameThread
The GameThread class represents a thread that handles the execution of a game.
GUI
This class represents the GUI interface for the game.
GUITurnSelectionHandler
This class represents Turn Selection Handler.
IpConfig
The IpConfig class represents the IP configuration of the client and the server.
Item
This class represents an item in the game.
ItemDeck
This class represents the concrete ItemDeck.
LoginController
The LoginController class handles the user login process.
Matrix<T>
Matrix is the simplest possible implementation for a matrix of T type elements.
MaxNumberOfPlayersException
Exception thrown when the maximum number of players is exceeded.
Message
This class represents a message that is sent between the server and clients during communication.
MessageClassEnum
An enumeration representing the message class types.
MessageDispatcher
The MessageDispatcher class handles the communication between the server and the client.
MessageTypeEnum
Enumeration representing the types of messages exchanged between client and server.
MethodNameEnum
Enumeration of method names used in messages.
MissingPlayerException
An exception that is thrown when a player is missing in the game.
NumberOfPlayersException
This exception is thrown when the number of players is not valid.
Observer
The Observer interface represents an observer in the game.
ObserverRMI
The ObserverRMI class represents an observer in the game.
ObserverSocket
The ObserverSocket class represents an observer that communicates with the server via socket.
PersonalGoal
This class represents all the Personal Goals in the game and provides methods to initialize and evaluate personal goals for a player.
PersonalGoalDeck
This class represents the concrete PersonalGoalDeck.
PickDoesntFitColumnException
Exception thrown when a picked item doesn't fit in a column.
PickedColumnOutOfBoundsException
Exception thrown when a column index is out of bounds in the context of the game board.
PingingTUI
The PingingTUI class represents a thread that pings the server every 5 seconds.
Player
This class represents a player.
PlayerIdAlreadyInUseException
Exception thrown when a player ID is already in use.
PlayerIsWaitingException
This exception is thrown when a player is in a waiting state.
PlayerOnlineException
An exception that is thrown when a player is already online.
PlayerState
This class represents the state of a player during the game.
PlayerStateSelecting
This state represents the state of a player that is selecting the tiles from the board.
PlayerStateWaiting
This state represents the state of a player that is waiting for their turn.
PlayerStatusToFile
This class represents the status of a player to be saved to a file.
ProxyDataInputStream
The ProxyDataInputStream class is used to read UTF-encoded strings from a message dispatcher based on the message class.
ProxyDataOutputStream
The ProxyDataOutputStream class is responsible for writing data to an output stream using a message dispatcher.
RemoteClient
The RemoteClient interface represents a remote client in the game.
RemoteUI
The RemoteUI interface represents the remote user interface for the client.
SelectionIsEmptyException
An exception that is thrown when a selection is empty.
SelectionIsFullException
Exception thrown when a selection is full.
SelectionNotValidException
Exception thrown when a selection is not valid.
Server
The server class for the game.
ServerMethodCallHandler
The ServerMethodCallHandler class represents a handler for a method call from the server.
TilesSelectionSizeDifferentFromOrderLengthException
Exception thrown when the size of the selected tiles is different from the length of the order.
TUI
Represents the Textual User Interface (TUI) for the game.
TypeEnum
This enum is used to set the type of the items used in the game.
UI
The UI interface represents a user interface.
UserApp
The UI interface represents a user interface.
Utils
Represents a collection of utility functions.
ViewController
The ViewController interface represents the view for classes that act as controllers.
VoidBoardTileException
Exception thrown when attempting to access a void board tile.
WrongConfigurationException
Exception thrown when the configuration of the game is incorrect.
WrongMessageClassEnumException
Exception thrown when an incorrect message class enumeration is encountered.
WrongPasswordException
This exception is thrown when an incorrect password is provided.
